title: C Programming for Beginners
description: Welcome to C Programming for Beginners! This tutorial will guide you through the fundamentals of C, one of the most influential programming languages ever created. You'll learn everything from basic syntax to building your first real program. No prior programming experience required.

content.text: C is a powerful general-purpose programming language created by Dennis Ritchie in 1972. It's been the foundation for operating systems, embedded systems, and countless other applications. Learning C gives you a deep understanding of how computers work at a fundamental level.
Before we write code, you'll need to set up your development environment. For this tutorial, we recommend using GCC (GNU Compiler Collection), which is available on Windows, macOS, and Linux.

Let's break down what each part does:
#include <stdio.h> - This line includes the Standard Input/Output library, which gives us access to printf() and other I/O functions.
int main() - This is the main function where program execution begins. Every C program must have exactly one main() function.
printf() - This function prints text to the console. The \n creates a new line.
return 0; - This tells the operating system that the program finished successfully.

content.text: Modify the program to print your name instead of "World". Try adding multiple printf() statements to print on different lines.
Variables are containers that hold data. In C, you must declare variables with their type before using them. Here are the fundamental data types:

content.code:
int age = 25;           // Integer numbers
float price = 19.99;     // Decimal numbers
char grade = 'A';        // Single characters
double pi = 3.14159;     // High-precision decimals

content.text: The type tells the compiler how much memory to allocate and how to interpret the data. Each type has different size and range limitations.

items: Always use & with scanf() for basic types (int, float, char). This is one of the most common mistakes beginners make!
